section.name: Configuration
section.p: Configuring Forward is not that difficult. This page documents everything you need to do.

section.name: Java Runtime Environment (JRE)
section.p: Forward requires Java 8. Both the Windows and Linux downloads come embedded with a Java 8 JRE, so Forward does not depend on the system-level JRE to run.
However, if you want to override the JRE that comes embedded with Forward, you can do so by editing either the [FORWARD_HOME]/bin/start-forward.sh or the [FORWARD_HOME]\bin\start-forward.bat file.

section.name: Logging
section.p: See the Logging page for more information about configuring logging.

section.name: SMTP and POP Account
section.p: Forward needs the SMTP and POP information for your email provider. Each email provider is different so how you get this information is up to you.
Copy [FORWARD_HOME]/conf/email(example).properties as [FORWARD_HOME]/conf/email.properties. Edit email.properties, adding your SMTP and POP account details.
section.source:
# Hostname of the SMTP server host=smtp.somewhere.org
# Port of the SMTP server port=44
# Your email account username username=someone
# Your email account clear-text password password=password
# Your email address emailAddress=Someone Special <someone@somewhere.org>
# Hostname of the POP server pop3sHost=pop.somewhere.org
# Port of the POP server pop3sPort=995
# Name of the folder to POP, typically don't change this. pop3sFolder=INBOX

section.name: Forwarding rules
section.p: Forward uses an XML document to store its fowarding rules. Copy [FORWARD_HOME]/conf/rules(example).xml as [FORWARD_HOME]/conf/rules.xml. Edit rules.xml, adding your forwarding rules.
This complete documentation of the XML document.
section.source:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Rules> <!-- MATCH 'from address' AND 'subject'
Delete messages after forwarding them. --> <Rule> <ForwardAddress>Real Name <forward.to.me@somewhere.org></ForwardAddress> <FromPattern>^regular.*expression[pattern](match)</FromPattern> <SubjectPattern>^regular.*expression[pattern](match)</SubjectPattern> <DeleteMessage>true</DeleteMessage> </Rule>
<!-- MATCH 'from address' only
Do not messages after forwarding them. --> <Rule> <ForwardAddress>Real Name <forward.to.me@somewhere.org></ForwardAddress> <FromPattern>^regular.*expression[pattern](match)</FromPattern> <DeleteMessage>false</DeleteMessage> </Rule>
<!-- MATCH 'subject' only
Delete messages after forwarding them. --> <Rule> <ForwardAddress>Real Name <forward.to.me@somewhere.org></ForwardAddress> <SubjectPattern>^regular.*expression[pattern](match)</SubjectPattern> <DeleteMessage>true</DeleteMessage> </Rule> </Rules>
section.p: Configuration complete! Next is Scheduling to run!.
